definition: to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
surname Yao
to shake/to rock/to row/to crank
flag/variant of 旗[qi2]
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
battle cry
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)

sentences.english: They are wavers of flags and shouters of slogans.
Bright-eyed bankers peddle ideas for other combinations.
sentences.chinese: 明眼的银行家们为另外的联手行动摇旗呐喊。

sentences.english: They are waver of flags and shouters of slogans.
sentences.chinese: 他们都是些摇旗呐喊的人。

sentences.english: The next day, Zhang Ren led several thousand out of the city.
sentences.chinese: 次日，张任引数千人马，摇旗呐喊，出城搦战。

to inflate/to pump up/fig. to encourage/to boost morale
to acclaim/to cheer
to complain of an injustice/to lament sb's misfortune
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
din
to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)

lackey/errand boy/lit. runner before a carriage
to charge and break through enemy lines
to push the wave and add to the billows (idiom); to add momentum/to encourage sth to get bigger/to add fuel to the fire
to change sides in a war/turncoat

to complain bitterly
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
